alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Camden and northeastern Gloucester Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pitman, or 8 miles south of Gloucester City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glassboro, Lindenwold, Pitman, Berlin, Woodbury Heights, Atco, Sicklerville, Williamstown, Turnersville, Monroe Township, Mullica Hill, Pine Hill, Stratford, Clementon, Wenonah, Gibbsboro, Laurel Springs, Pine Valley, Oak Valley and Blackwood. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 35 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
